title: Research Associate
text:
Job Ref: 3871BR 
An opportunity has arisen to join DECIPHer, one of five UKCRC Public Health Research Centres of Excellence. Working with colleagues in DECIPHer, the South East Wales Trial Unit (SEWTU), the University of Bristol, Bangor University, the University of Glasgow and Durham University, you will coordinate the successful delivery of a Health and Care Research Wales funded project. This study aims to evaluate the feasibility and acceptability of implementing and trialling accelerometry-based activity monitors in the Welsh National Exercise Referral Scheme prior to a potential future larger scale evaluation. 
The successful applicant will be responsible for the day-to-day management and co-ordination of the project, including organising data collection, collecting quantitative and qualitative data (including conducting interviews with participants and staff), collating data from the scheme database with study data, contributing to quantitative and qualitative data analysis of data, and writing up and presenting findings. 
With a first or good second class degree in a relevant discipline (or equivalent experience), you will also have a PhD in social science, public health and/or another relevant discipline (other relevant equivalent research experience would be considered). 
You should be highly organised, have excellent verbal communication skills, and a proven ability to manage projects and meet deadlines within the framework of an agreed programme. The ability to work collaboratively with others is essential. You will also have experience in qualitative research methods, managing research projects, and a demonstrable history of contributing to publications. 
This position would suit a self-motivated individual with a proactive approach to work who wants to join a thriving public health research centre. The need to identify and develop areas for future research within this role will also require initiative, creativity and grant writing skills. 
For informal queries, please contact Dr Jemma Hawkins (Research Fellow) on hawkinsj10@cardiff.ac.uk 029 2087 9609. 
This position is full time (35 hours per week) and fixed-term until 30th September 2017 
Interviews will be held on Thursday 22nd October 
Please be aware that Cardiff University reserves the right to close this vacancy early should sufficient applications be received. Share this job
